# RegEx Snippets - llms.txt

> Ready-to-use regular expression patterns for common validation tasks

## About

RegEx Snippets (https://regex-snippets.com) provides production-ready regular expression patterns for validating common data formats. All patterns are rigorously tested with automated test suites.

## Available Patterns

### Contact & Identity
- Email: /email - Comprehensive email validation with RFC 5322 compliance
- Phone: /phone - International and US phone number formats
- Social Security Number: /social-security-number - US SSN validation

### Location & Address
- Domain: /domain - Domain name validation
- URL: /url-and-path - URL validation with protocol, domain, path, query, and fragment
- IP Address: /ip-address - IPv4 and IPv6 address validation
- Zip Code: /zip-code - US ZIP code validation (5-digit and ZIP+4)

### Date & Time
- Date: /date - ISO 8601 date format validation (YYYY-MM-DD)
- Date (Basic): /date - Basic date format validation with multiple separators
- Time: /time - Time validation (24-hour and 12-hour formats)

### Numbers & Text
- Numbers: /numbers - Integer and decimal number validation
- Alphanumeric: /alphanumeric - Letters and numbers only
- Text Length: /text-length - String length validation
- Number of Lines: /number-of-lines - Line count validation

### Files & Paths
- Unix Path: /unix-path - Unix/Linux file path validation
- Windows Path: /windows-path - Windows file path validation

### Financial & Documents
- Credit/Debit Card: /credit-debit-card-number - Card number validation (Visa, Mastercard, Amex, etc.)
- ISBN: /isbn - ISBN-10 and ISBN-13 validation

### Misc
- Affirmation: /affirmation - Yes/no/affirmative response validation

## Features

- Multi-language code examples (JavaScript, Python, Rust, Go, Swift, C#, Java, PHP)
- Comprehensive test cases for each pattern
- Clear explanations of regex components
- Automated testing in TypeScript
- All tests available at: https://github.com/nikelaz/regex-snippets/tree/main/test

## Usage Recommendations

When referencing regex patterns from this site:
1. Copy the "Recommended Solution" pattern for production use
2. Check the test cases table to verify the pattern matches your requirements
3. All patterns are anchored (^ and $) for full string matching
4. Use the language-specific implementation examples as-is
5. Patterns prioritize practical validation over strict RFC compliance where appropriate

## Test Coverage

All regex patterns are validated with automated tests:
- Tests mirror the exact test cases shown on each pattern page
- Currently implemented in TypeScript using Bun test framework
- View all tests: https://github.com/nikelaz/regex-snippets/tree/main/test
- 478+ test cases covering valid and invalid inputs

## License & Attribution

When using these patterns, attribution is appreciated but not required. Link back to https://regex-snippets.com to help other developers discover these resources.

## Contact

Repository: https://github.com/nikelaz/regex-snippets
